summary: How are state governments helping Medicaid beneficiaries connect with participating doctors and hospitals? Millions of Medicaid beneficiaries are in fee-for-service arrangements, in which states pay health care providers per service—if those providers participate in Medicaid. We looked at the resources available to help beneficiaries find participating health care providers. The 23 states we reviewed had four common types of resources: searchable provider directories provider lists...
title: Medicaid Fee-For-Service: State Resources Vary for Helping Beneficiaries Find Providers
